item.title: DNS For Dummies
item.author: cap@blackett.lol (blackett)
item.description: About A (somewhat) brief overview of the domain name system. It’s worth knowing on a deeper level just how we can get to www.example.com without knowing the IP address of the web server delivering the page. Contents 1 - The Domain Name System 2 - Querying A DNS Server 3 - Types of DNS Server 4 - DNS Record Propagation 5 - Querying A DNS Server (Again) 6 - Types Of DNS Record 7 - Closing Thoughts 8 - Advanced Reading DNS Overview The Domain Name System As you may already know, computers communicate over networks using IP addresses to identify the specific device they are sending traffic to.

item.title: That Thing
item.author: cap@blackett.lol (blackett)
item.description: Contents That Thing You Were Thinking About Doing Second Opinion Asking Someone Else Google Searching It But What If I…? Person XYZ You Don’t Want Me To Have Fun What To Do Instead Contact That Thing You Were Thinking About Doing Don’t. Second Opinion Yeah, don’t. Asking Someone Else They’ll say the same. Google Searching It Be my guest. But What If I…? Doesn’t change my answer. Don’t. But It’s Really Important!

item.title: Brute Forcing
item.author: cap@blackett.lol (blackett)
item.description: Ahhh… brute forcing, my old friend… Brute forcing. What fun, eh? Can’t pick a lock? Knock the door down! If you’re reading this article then you’ve been linked it because someone thinks you should learn why brute forcing is not the hotness you’ve been lead to believe it is. So what is brute forcing anyway? In short, it’s trying to guess every possible combination of characters and hoping it matches. Let’s play a game.
